item.title: Report E-2024060467
item.description:
Report E-2024060467

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USU experienced a UN1760 Captain XTR release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete dock floor due to being crushed by boxes of the same material stacked on top of it. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted areas were then wiped clean. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024060477
item.description:
Report E-2024060477

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 2-gallons of Refined Confectionary Glaze was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged drum, and oil-dri was placed into a 75-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2024061039
item.description:
Report X-2024061039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WEARING FULL PPE AND FOLLOWING DECISION TREE, RESPONDER RESPONDED TO TRAILER, PLACED PACKAGE IN LINED SPILL TRAY AND RETURNED TO PROCESSING CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION OF CONTENTS, DISCOVERED THAT THE INTERNAL PACKAGE HAD A CLASS 8 DIAMOND LABEL. THE EXTERNAL PACKAGE HAD NO INDICATIONS OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS. CALLED HMSC AND CONFIRMED IT WAS UNDECLARED. FOLLOWED UNDECLARED PROCEDURE.
